references.paper_title: Diffusion bridge mixture transports, Schrödinger bridge problems and generative modeling
references.reason: This paper provides the theoretical foundation for the Iterative Markovian Fitting (IMF) procedure, which is central to the proposed D-IMF approach.
This paper introduces the continuous-time IMF procedure, which the authors improve upon with their discrete-time version.
This foundational paper on Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) provides the basis for the adversarial learning framework used in the ASBM algorithm.

references.paper_title: A survey of the Schrödinger problem and some of its connections with optimal transport
references.reason: This paper offers a comprehensive overview of the Schrödinger Bridge problem, which is the core theoretical problem addressed in the work.

references.paper_title: Tackling the generative learning trilemma with denoising diffusion GANs
references.reason: This paper introduces the Denoising Diffusion GAN (DD-GAN), a key component of the proposed ASBM algorithm for practical implementation.
